result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason M. Agnes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must report to probation today. May be considered for early release once restitution is paid in full.
Concurrent with: Any Minnesota Sentence

miscConds.notes: $622.96 restitution to be paid to Probation while on Probation. Restitution will be modified to a civil judgment instantly if not paid by the end of probation.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.
No voting or holding public office until civil rights are restored. If not a U.S. Citizen may face deportation.
Must give a DNA sample, no surcharge. Eligible for "our" boot camp and "our" substance abuse program.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason M. Agnes

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jason M. Agnes in court with attorney Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp.  Defendant Jason M. Agnes in custody.  Stephen C. Dorrance appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KK Clerk 8:58AM  Defendant enters a plea of G to charge.  Defendant waives PSI.  Court - accepts plea of G and finds defendant G.  Repeater striken.  No firearms or body armor.  May not vote while on status.  Cannot hold public office until civil rights are restored.  If not a US citizen may face deportation.  Defendant is eligible for "our" boot camp and eligible for "our" substance abuse program.  SENTENCE: w/held 2.5 years Probation, concurrent with MN sentence.  may be considered for early release once restitution is paid off.   Restitution in the amount of $622.96 to Walmart - modified  to civil judgment instantly if not paid by the end of probation.  No costs, DNA sample - no surcharge.  adj. 9:24AM
